item.title: 期权 "寿终正寝"，为创纪录股票套期保值的投资者举步维艰
item.description: 在牛市中，没有暴跌，没有突然的剧烈波动，也没有持久的修正，谨慎的投资者正在努力寻找对冲头寸的有效方法。【原文：In a bull market with no crashes, no sudden spikes in volatility and no lasting correction, cautious investors are struggling to find effective ways to hedge their positions.】

item.title: 瑞士宝盛集团据说正在权衡收购瑞士竞争对手 EFG 的潜在交易
item.description: 据知情人士透露，瑞士宝盛集团（Julius Baer Group Ltd.）正在探讨收购竞争对手瑞士私人银行 EFG International AG 的可能性。【原文：Julius Baer Group Ltd. is exploring a potential acquisition of rival Swiss private bank EFG International AG, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 欧元区通胀低迷不太可能阻碍欧洲央行降息
item.description: 本月欧元区通胀可能回升，但这不可能破坏欧洲央行即将降息的大势。【原文：A probable pickup in euro-zone inflation this month is unlikely to derail the juggernaut of an imminent interest-rate cut by the European Central Bank.】

item.title: 美银美林称英伟达股票分拆似乎将成为科技界众多分拆中的首例
item.description: 本周早些时候，英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.美国银行（Bank of America）的一份报告称，此举可能是一种趋势的开端，因为几家著名科技公司的交易价格高得足以让人倾向于类似的拆股。【原文：Nvidia Corp. delighted investors when it announced a 10-for-1 stock split earlier this week. The move may be the start of a trend, as several prominent tech companies trade at prices high enough to tip the scales toward similar splits, according to a note from Bank of America.】

item.title: 石油公司就债务上限发出威胁后，哥伦比亚债券和比索下跌
item.description: 哥伦比亚总统古斯塔沃-彼得罗（Gustavo Petro）威胁说，如果立法者拒绝批准提高国家债务上限，他将 "停止支付"，此后哥伦比亚的债券和货币纷纷下跌。【原文：Colombia’s bonds and currency dropped after President Gustavo Petro threatened to “cease payments” if lawmakers refuse to approve an increase in the nation’s debt ceiling.】

item.title: 印度最大电力生产商利润因税收支出增加而下降
item.description: 印度最大的电力生产商南太电力公司（NTPC Ltd. ）第四季度利润下降，原因是税费支出激增，尽管售电量有所增长。【原文：India’s largest power producer NTPC Ltd.’s fourth-quarter profit dropped on account of a jump in tax expenses, even as electricity sales rose.】

item.title: 奈杰尔-法拉奇的 "改革英国 "为何让保守党束手无策？
item.description: 该党在议会中没有一个席位，但在英国准备于 7 月举行大选之际，"改革英国 "却在影响着英国政治的走向。该党的巨大影响力可以追溯到联合创始人奈杰尔-法拉奇（Nigel Farage），他是英国脱欧运动的关键人物。尽管他所承诺的脱欧后的民族复兴尚未实现，但法拉奇在该国贫困地区选民中的影响力依然存在，而执政的保守党需要这些选民继续支持他们。【原文：It lacks a single seat in Parliament, yet Reform UK is shaping the direction of British politics as the country gears up for a general election in July. The party’s outsize influence can be traced to co-founder Nigel Farage, a key figure in the campaign to take Britain out of the European Union. Although the post-Brexit national renaissance he promised is yet to materialize, Farage’s pulling power endures with voters in poorer regions of the country whom the ruling Conservatives need to keep on】

item.title: 纳格尔称欧洲央行应等到 9 月再进行第二次降息
item.description: 德国央行行长约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）表示，欧洲央行在 6 月份开始降低借贷成本后，可能应等到 9 月份再降息。【原文：The European Central Bank should probably wait until September for any subsequent interest-rate cut after it begins reducing borrowing costs in June, Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel said.】

item.title: 阿联酋将比预测提前一年实现石油产能目标
item.description: 阿拉伯联合酋长国将比预期提前一年多实现其全部石油产能目标。【原文：The United Arab Emirates is on course to achieve its full oil capacity target more than a year earlier than expected.】

item.title: 美联储主席沃勒尔称降低中性利率的因素可能逆转
item.description: 美联储理事克里斯托弗-沃勒说，随着时间的推移，中性利率下降可能是由于全球对安全资产的需求发生了重大变化，不过他警告说，不可持续的财政支出可能会改变这一趋势。【原文：Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said the decline in the neutral interest rate over time is likely due to significant changes in demand for safe assets globally, though he warned that unsustainable fiscal spending could alter that trend.】

item.title: 欧洲央行穆勒称工资跳涨不会导致通胀放缓
item.description: 欧洲央行管理委员会成员马迪斯-穆勒（Madis Muller）表示，欧元区薪资的一个关键指标出现跳升，但这并不会破坏通胀的持续回落，也不会阻止欧洲央行在 6 月份降低利率。【原文：The jump in a key gauge of euro-zone pay doesn’t derail the ongoing retreat in inflation and won’t stop the European Central Bank from lowering interest rates in June, Governing Council member Madis Muller said.】

item.title: 亿万富翁标致在特许权使用费问题上向愤怒的股东低头
item.description: 亿万富翁标致家族将对一家公开上市的投资公司因使用家族姓氏而支付的费用设定上限，以回应对公司业绩不满的小股东的批评。【原文：The billionaire Peugeot family will cap the payments it receives from a publicly traded investment company for the use of the family name, bowing to criticism from minority shareholders who are upset at the performance of the business.】

item.title: 三天经济数据揭示英国大选分界线
item.description: 英国首相苏纳克（Rishi Sunak）宣布举行临时大选后公布的第一波英国经济数据已经揭示了两大政党的主要分界线。【原文：The first wave of UK economic data published since Prime Minister Rishi Sunak called a snap general election is already revealing the key dividing lines that separate the two main parties.】

item.title: 对前景的担忧加剧，Lululemon 跌至 S&P 500 指数谷底
item.description: 本周，Lululemon Athletica Inc.的开年黯淡表现进一步恶化，因为就在该公司发布财报之前，一位重要高管的离职加剧了华尔街对其前景的担忧。【原文：A bleak start to the year for Lululemon Athletica Inc. worsened this week after the departure of a key executive exacerbated Wall Street’s concerns around the outlook for the activewear company just ahead of its earnings report.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚计划通过推动更多钻井提高石油产量
item.description: 哥伦比亚最高能源官员表示，哥伦比亚的石油日产量目标是 100 万桶，为此将向钻探商施压，要求他们在未充分利用的勘探区块加强活动。【原文：Colombia is targeting oil output of 1 million barrels per day by pressuring drillers to step up activity in underused exploration blocs, according to the nation’s top energy official.】

item.title: PGIM 称降息将引发债券购买潮
item.description: PGIM 认为，全球最大央行的首次降息将使仍对重返债券市场持谨慎态度的投资者更加大胆，并引发 "洪水般的 "资金流入。【原文：The first interest-rate cut from the world’s biggest central banks will embolden investors still cautious about stepping back into the bond market and trigger a “flood” of inflows, according to PGIM.】

item.title: 在英伟达取得成功后，投资者为人工智能赢家撒下更广阔的投资网
item.description: 尽管对英伟达公司业绩的反应表明，华尔街对人工智能的关注度依然很高，但投资者正越来越多地把目光投向普通公司之外，以寻找下一个人工智能赢家。【原文：While the reaction to Nvidia Corp.’s results showed that Wall Street remains laser-focused on artificial intelligence, investors are increasingly looking beyond the usual suspects to find the next AI winners.】

item.title: 尼日利亚禁止奈拉街头交易，受创货币再遭重创
item.description: 尼日利亚加大力度遏制对遭受重创的奈拉的投机行为，对货币兑换所提出了苛刻的新条件，并禁止街头外汇交易。【原文：Nigeria stepped up efforts to curb speculation against the battered naira, slapping tough new conditions on bureau de change and banning street trading in foreign currency.】

item.title: 尼日利亚第一季度经济增速略有放缓
item.description: 尼日利亚第一季度的经济增长速度低于预期，原因是货币大幅下滑给非石油部门造成了损失。【原文：Nigeria’s economy grew at a slower than expected rate in the first quarter as a sharp currency slump took a toll on the non-oil sector.】

item.title: 高盛将美联储首次降息时间从 7 月推迟至 9 月
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：The Federal Reserve will only start cutting interest rates in September, according to economists at Goldman Sachs Group Inc., who pushed back their call from July amid signs the economy is still too resilient to justify easing.】

item.title: 与马来西亚前政治家有关的伦敦办公室被撤出销售
item.description: 据知情人士透露，伦敦金融城一栋与马来西亚前政客家族有关的办公楼已被撤回出售。【原文：A City of London office building linked to the family of a former Malaysian politician has been withdrawn from sale, according to people with knowledge of the process.】

item.title: 挪威财富基金反对埃克森董事提起气候诉讼
item.description: 挪威 1.6 万亿美元的财富基金表示，在埃克森美孚公司（Exxon Mobil Corp）董事约瑟夫-胡利（Joseph Hooley）对关注气候问题的股东提起诉讼后，该基金将于下周投票反对其当选。【原文：Norway’s $1.6 trillion wealth fund said it will vote next week against the election of Exxon Mobil Corp Director Joseph Hooley after the oil and gas giant filed a lawsuit against climate-focused shareholders.】

item.title: 泰晤士河水务公司贷款人将在大选悬而未决之际出售 5 亿英镑贷款
item.description: 据知情人士透露，陷入困境的公用事业公司泰晤士水务公司（Thames Water）的一家贷款机构正寻求出售该公司约 5 亿英镑（约合 6.355 亿美元）的贷款。【原文：A lender to beleaguered utility Thames Water is looking to sell about £500 million ($635.5 million) of the company’s loans, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事美洲
item.description: 早上好。美联储可能不得不将利率维持更长时间的押注令股市萎靡不振，而一位政策制定者则质疑央行的主要工具是否已变得不那么有效。以下是市场动态。【原文：Good morning. Stocks wilt on bets the Fed might have to keep rates on hold for longer, while a policy maker questions if the central bank’s main tool has become less effective. Here’s what’s moving markets. — David Goodman】

item.title: 蓬勃发展的对冲基金期权交易面临被挤垮的风险
item.description: 对冲基金和波动性交易者曾经钟爱的一种小众股票交易，如今已膨胀为华尔街最大的期权策略之一，这不禁让人担心它将被自己的受欢迎程度所击垮。【原文：A once-niche stock trade beloved by hedge funds and volatility players has ballooned into one of the biggest options strategies on Wall Street, stirring fears it will get crushed by its own popularity.】

item.title: 四月份外商对华投资连续第四个月下降
item.description: 4 月份，进入中国的外商投资连续第四个月放缓，凸显出中国政府在努力吸引更多海外资金以促进其疲软的经济增长。【原文：Foreign investment into China slowed for a fourth straight month in April, underscoring Beijing’s struggle to attract more overseas funds to boost its flagging economic growth.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长纳格尔称 6 月减息的可能性正逐渐增大
item.description: 德国央行行长约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）表示，欧洲央行有望在下次会议上降低借贷成本。【原文：The European Central Bank is on track to lower borrowing costs at its next meeting, according to Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel.】

item.title: 套利交易风靡全球债券和外汇市场
item.description: 在未来几个月里，利用利率差异将成为最受欢迎的投资策略之一，因为市场押注较浅的降息幅度将抑制波动性。【原文：Exploiting differences in interest rates is set to become one of the most popular investment strategies in coming months as markets bet shallower cuts will keep volatility subdued.】
